         <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
            <header class="preface-titlepage">
               <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
            </header>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">SOLINUS, Duke of Ephesus. </span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">AEGEON, a merchant of Syracuse.</span>
            </p>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS</span>
                        <span class="personname">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">twin brothers, and sons to Aegeon and Aemilia.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
               <tr>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">
                        <span class="personname">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</span>
                        <span class="personname">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</span>
                     </span>
                  </td>
                  <td>
                     <span class="member">twin brothers, and attendants on the two Antipholuses.</span>
                  </td>
               </tr>
            </table>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">BALTHAZAR, a merchant</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">ANGELO, a goldsmith.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">First Merchant, friend to Antipholus of Syracuse.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Second Merchant, to whom Angelo is a debtor.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">PINCH, a schoolmaster.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">AEMILIA, wife to Aegeon, an abbess at Ephesus.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">ADRIANA, wife to Antipholus of Ephesus.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">LUCIANA, her sister.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">LUCE, servant to Adriana.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">A Courtezan.</span>
            </p>
            <p>
               <span class="personname">Gaoler, Officers, and other Attendants</span>
            </p>
            <p>SCENE  Ephesus.</p>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II.  The Mart.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DUKE SOLINUS, AEGEON, Gaoler, Officers, and other
Attendants</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AEGEON</div>
                     <div class="line">Proceed, Solinus, to procure my fall</div>
                     <div class="line">And by the doom of death end woes and all.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Merchant of Syracuse, plead no more;</div>
                     <div class="line">I am not partial to infringe our laws:</div>
                     <div class="line">The enmity and discord which of late</div>
                     <div class="line">Sprung from the rancorous outrage of your duke</div>
                     <div class="line">To merchants, our well-dealing countrymen,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who wanting guilders to redeem their lives</div>
                     <div class="line">Have seal'd his rigorous statutes with their bloods,</div>
                     <div class="line">Excludes all pity from our threatening looks.</div>
                     <div class="line">For, since the mortal and intestine jars</div>
                     <div class="line">'Twixt thy seditious countrymen and us,</div>
                     <div class="line">It hath in solemn synods been decreed</div>
                     <div class="line">Both by the Syracusians and ourselves,</div>
                     <div class="line">To admit no traffic to our adverse towns Nay, more,</div>
                     <div class="line">If any born at Ephesus be seen</div>
                     <div class="line">At any Syracusian marts and fairs;</div>
                     <div class="line">Again: if any Syracusian born</div>
                     <div class="line">Come to the bay of Ephesus, he dies,</div>
                     <div class="line">His goods confiscate to the duke's dispose,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless a thousand marks be levied,</div>
                     <div class="line">To quit the penalty and to ransom him.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy substance, valued at the highest rate,</div>
                     <div class="line">Cannot amount unto a hundred marks;</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore by law thou art condemned to die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AEGEON</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet this my comfort: when your words are done,</div>
                     <div class="line">My woes end likewise with the evening sun.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, Syracusian, say in brief the cause</div>
                     <div class="line">Why thou departed'st from thy native home</div>
                     <div class="line">And for what cause thou camest to Ephesus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AEGEON</div>
                     <div class="line">A heavier task could not have been imposed</div>
                     <div class="line">Than I to speak my griefs unspeakable:</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet, that the world may witness that my end</div>
                     <div class="line">Was wrought by nature, not by vile offence,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll utter what my sorrows give me leave.</div>
                     <div class="line">In Syracusa was I born, and wed</div>
                     <div class="line">Unto a woman, happy but for me,</div>
                     <div class="line">And by me, had not our hap been bad.</div>
                     <div class="line">With her I lived in joy; our wealth increased</div>
                     <div class="line">By prosperous voyages I often made</div>
                     <div class="line">To Epidamnum; till my factor's death</div>
                     <div class="line">And the great care of goods at random left</div>
                     <div class="line">Drew me from kind embracements of my spouse:</div>
                     <div class="line">From whom my absence was not six months old</div>
                     <div class="line">Before herself, almost at fainting under</div>
                     <div class="line">The pleasing punishment that women bear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Had made provision for her following me</div>
                     <div class="line">And soon and safe arrived where I was.</div>
                     <div class="line">There had she not been long, but she became</div>
                     <div class="line">A joyful mother of two goodly sons;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, which was strange, the one so like the other,</div>
                     <div class="line">As could not be distinguish'd but by names.</div>
                     <div class="line">That very hour, and in the self-same inn,</div>
                     <div class="line">A meaner woman was delivered</div>
                     <div class="line">Of such a burden, male twins, both alike:</div>
                     <div class="line">Those,--for their parents were exceeding poor,--</div>
                     <div class="line">I bought and brought up to attend my sons.</div>
                     <div class="line">My wife, not meanly proud of two such boys,</div>
                     <div class="line">Made daily motions for our home return:</div>
                     <div class="line">Unwilling I agreed. Alas! too soon,</div>
                     <div class="line">We came aboard.</div>
                     <div class="line">A league from Epidamnum had we sail'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Before the always wind-obeying deep</div>
                     <div class="line">Gave any tragic instance of our harm:</div>
                     <div class="line">But longer did we not retain much hope;</div>
                     <div class="line">For what obscured light the heavens did grant</div>
                     <div class="line">Did but convey unto our fearful minds</div>
                     <div class="line">A doubtful warrant of immediate death;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which though myself would gladly have embraced,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet the incessant weepings of my wife,</div>
                     <div class="line">Weeping before for what she saw must come,</div>
                     <div class="line">And piteous plainings of the pretty babes,</div>
                     <div class="line">That mourn'd for fashion, ignorant what to fear,</div>
                     <div class="line">Forced me to seek delays for them and me.</div>
                     <div class="line">And this it was, for other means was none:</div>
                     <div class="line">The sailors sought for safety by our boat,</div>
                     <div class="line">And left the ship, then sinking-ripe, to us:</div>
                     <div class="line">My wife, more careful for the latter-born,</div>
                     <div class="line">Had fasten'd him unto a small spare mast,</div>
                     <div class="line">Such as seafaring men provide for storms;</div>
                     <div class="line">To him one of the other twins was bound,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whilst I had been like heedful of the other:</div>
                     <div class="line">The children thus disposed, my wife and I,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fixing our eyes on whom our care was fix'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fasten'd ourselves at either end the mast;</div>
                     <div class="line">And floating straight, obedient to the stream,</div>
                     <div class="line">Was carried towards Corinth, as we thought.</div>
                     <div class="line">At length the sun, gazing upon the earth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Dispersed those vapours that offended us;</div>
                     <div class="line">And by the benefit of his wished light,</div>
                     <div class="line">The seas wax'd calm, and we discovered</div>
                     <div class="line">Two ships from far making amain to us,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of Corinth that, of Epidaurus this:</div>
                     <div class="line">But ere they came,--O, let me say no more!</div>
                     <div class="line">Gather the sequel by that went before.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, forward, old man; do not break off so;</div>
                     <div class="line">For we may pity, though not pardon thee.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AEGEON</div>
                     <div class="line">O, had the gods done so, I had not now</div>
                     <div class="line">Worthily term'd them merciless to us!</div>
                     <div class="line">For, ere the ships could meet by twice five leagues,</div>
                     <div class="line">We were encounterd by a mighty rock;</div>
                     <div class="line">Which being violently borne upon,</div>
                     <div class="line">Our helpful ship was splitted in the midst;</div>
                     <div class="line">So that, in this unjust divorce of us,</div>
                     <div class="line">Fortune had left to both of us alike</div>
                     <div class="line">What to delight in, what to sorrow for.</div>
                     <div class="line">Her part, poor soul! seeming as burdened</div>
                     <div class="line">With lesser weight but not with lesser woe,</div>
                     <div class="line">Was carried with more speed before the wind;</div>
                     <div class="line">And in our sight they three were taken up</div>
                     <div class="line">By fishermen of Corinth, as we thought.</div>
                     <div class="line">At length, another ship had seized on us;</div>
                     <div class="line">And, knowing whom it was their hap to save,</div>
                     <div class="line">Gave healthful welcome to their shipwreck'd guests;</div>
                     <div class="line">And would have reft the fishers of their prey,</div>
                     <div class="line">Had not their bark been very slow of sail;</div>
                     <div class="line">And therefore homeward did they bend their course.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus have you heard me sever'd from my bliss;</div>
                     <div class="line">That by misfortunes was my life prolong'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">To tell sad stories of my own mishaps.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                     <div class="line">And for the sake of them thou sorrowest for,</div>
                     <div class="line">Do me the favour to dilate at full</div>
                     <div class="line">What hath befall'n of them and thee till now.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AEGEON</div>
                     <div class="line">My youngest boy, and yet my eldest care,</div>
                     <div class="line">At eighteen years became inquisitive</div>
                     <div class="line">After his brother: and importuned me</div>
                     <div class="line">That his attendant--so his case was like,</div>
                     <div class="line">Reft of his brother, but retain'd his name--</div>
                     <div class="line">Might bear him company in the quest of him:</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom whilst I labour'd of a love to see,</div>
                     <div class="line">I hazarded the loss of whom I loved.</div>
                     <div class="line">Five summers have I spent in furthest Greece,</div>
                     <div class="line">Roaming clean through the bounds of Asia,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, coasting homeward, came to Ephesus;</div>
                     <div class="line">Hopeless to find, yet loath to leave unsought</div>
                     <div class="line">Or that or any place that harbours men.</div>
                     <div class="line">But here must end the story of my life;</div>
                     <div class="line">And happy were I in my timely death,</div>
                     <div class="line">Could all my travels warrant me they live.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Hapless AEgeon, whom the fates have mark'd</div>
                     <div class="line">To bear the extremity of dire mishap!</div>
                     <div class="line">Now, trust me, were it not against our laws,</div>
                     <div class="line">Against my crown, my oath, my dignity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which princes, would they, may not disannul,</div>
                     <div class="line">My soul would sue as advocate for thee.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, though thou art adjudged to the death</div>
                     <div class="line">And passed sentence may not be recall'd</div>
                     <div class="line">But to our honour's great disparagement,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet I will favour thee in what I can.</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, merchant, I'll limit thee this day</div>
                     <div class="line">To seek thy life by beneficial help:</div>
                     <div class="line">Try all the friends thou hast in Ephesus;</div>
                     <div class="line">Beg thou, or borrow, to make up the sum,</div>
                     <div class="line">And live; if no, then thou art doom'd to die.</div>
                     <div class="line">Gaoler, take him to thy custody.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Gaoler</div>
                     <div class="line">I will, my lord.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AEGEON</div>
                     <div class="line">Hopeless and helpless doth AEgeon wend,</div>
                     <div class="line">But to procrastinate his lifeless end.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.3.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  The Mart.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ANTIPHOLUS of Syracuse, DROMIO of Syracuse,
and First Merchant</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Merchant</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore give out you are of Epidamnum,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest that your goods too soon be confiscate.</div>
                     <div class="line">This very day a Syracusian merchant</div>
                     <div class="line">Is apprehended for arrival here;</div>
                     <div class="line">And not being able to buy out his life</div>
                     <div class="line">According to the statute of the town,</div>
                     <div class="line">Dies ere the weary sun set in the west.</div>
                     <div class="line">There is your money that I had to keep.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Go bear it to the Centaur, where we host,</div>
                     <div class="line">And stay there, Dromio, till I come to thee.</div>
                     <div class="line">Within this hour it will be dinner-time:</div>
                     <div class="line">Till that, I'll view the manners of the town,</div>
                     <div class="line">Peruse the traders, gaze upon the buildings,</div>
                     <div class="line">And then return and sleep within mine inn,</div>
                     <div class="line">For with long travel I am stiff and weary.</div>
                     <div class="line">Get thee away.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Many a man would take you at your word,</div>
                     <div class="line">And go indeed, having so good a mean.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">A trusty villain, sir, that very oft,</div>
                     <div class="line">When I am dull with care and melancholy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lightens my humour with his merry jests.</div>
                     <div class="line">What, will you walk with me about the town,</div>
                     <div class="line">And then go to my inn and dine with me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Merchant</div>
                     <div class="line">I am invited, sir, to certain merchants,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of whom I hope to make much benefit;</div>
                     <div class="line">I crave your pardon. Soon at five o'clock,</div>
                     <div class="line">Please you, I'll meet with you upon the mart</div>
                     <div class="line">And afterward consort you till bed-time:</div>
                     <div class="line">My present business calls me from you now.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Farewell till then: I will go lose myself</div>
                     <div class="line">And wander up and down to view the city.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">First Merchant</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, I commend you to your own content.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">He that commends me to mine own content</div>
                     <div class="line">Commends me to the thing I cannot get.</div>
                     <div class="line">I to the world am like a drop of water</div>
                     <div class="line">That in the ocean seeks another drop,</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, falling there to find his fellow forth,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unseen, inquisitive, confounds himself:</div>
                     <div class="line">So I, to find a mother and a brother,</div>
                     <div class="line">In quest of them, unhappy, lose myself.</div>
                     <p>Enter DROMIO of Ephesus</p>
                     <div class="line">Here comes the almanac of my true date.</div>
                     <div class="line">What now? how chance thou art return'd so soon?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Return'd so soon! rather approach'd too late:</div>
                     <div class="line">The capon burns, the pig falls from the spit,</div>
                     <div class="line">The clock hath strucken twelve upon the bell;</div>
                     <div class="line">My mistress made it one upon my cheek:</div>
                     <div class="line">She is so hot because the meat is cold;</div>
                     <div class="line">The meat is cold because you come not home;</div>
                     <div class="line">You come not home because you have no stomach;</div>
                     <div class="line">You have no stomach having broke your fast;</div>
                     <div class="line">But we that know what 'tis to fast and pray</div>
                     <div class="line">Are penitent for your default to-day.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Stop in your wind, sir: tell me this, I pray:</div>
                     <div class="line">Where have you left the money that I gave you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">O,--sixpence, that I had o' Wednesday last</div>
                     <div class="line">To pay the saddler for my mistress' crupper?</div>
                     <div class="line">The saddler had it, sir; I kept it not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">I am not in a sportive humour now:</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell me, and dally not, where is the money?</div>
                     <div class="line">We being strangers here, how darest thou trust</div>
                     <div class="line">So great a charge from thine own custody?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I pray you, air, as you sit at dinner:</div>
                     <div class="line">I from my mistress come to you in post;</div>
                     <div class="line">If I return, I shall be post indeed,</div>
                     <div class="line">For she will score your fault upon my pate.</div>
                     <div class="line">Methinks your maw, like mine, should be your clock,</div>
                     <div class="line">And strike you home without a messenger.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, Dromio, come, these jests are out of season;</div>
                     <div class="line">Reserve them till a merrier hour than this.</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is the gold I gave in charge to thee?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">To me, sir? why, you gave no gold to me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Come on, sir knave, have done your foolishness,</div>
                     <div class="line">And tell me how thou hast disposed thy charge.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">My charge was but to fetch you from the mart</div>
                     <div class="line">Home to your house, the Phoenix, sir, to dinner:</div>
                     <div class="line">My mistress and her sister stays for you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">In what safe place you have bestow'd my money,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or I shall break that merry sconce of yours</div>
                     <div class="line">That stands on tricks when I am undisposed:</div>
                     <div class="line">Where is the thousand marks thou hadst of me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I have some marks of yours upon my pate,</div>
                     <div class="line">Some of my mistress' marks upon my shoulders,</div>
                     <div class="line">But not a thousand marks between you both.</div>
                     <div class="line">If I should pay your worship those again,</div>
                     <div class="line">Perchance you will not bear them patiently.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Thy mistress' marks? what mistress, slave, hast thou?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Your worship's wife, my mistress at the Phoenix;</div>
                     <div class="line">She that doth fast till you come home to dinner,</div>
                     <div class="line">And prays that you will hie you home to dinner.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">What, wilt thou flout me thus unto my face,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being forbid? There, take you that, sir knave.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">What mean you, sir? for God's sake, hold your hands!</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, and you will not, sir, I'll take my heels.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon my life, by some device or other</div>
                     <div class="line">The villain is o'er-raught of all my money.</div>
                     <div class="line">They say this town is full of cozenage,</div>
                     <div class="line">As, nimble jugglers that deceive the eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">Dark-working sorcerers that change the mind,</div>
                     <div class="line">Soul-killing witches that deform the body,</div>
                     <div class="line">Disguised cheaters, prating mountebanks,</div>
                     <div class="line">And many such-like liberties of sin:</div>
                     <div class="line">If it prove so, I will be gone the sooner.</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll to the Centaur, to go seek this slave:</div>
                     <div class="line">I greatly fear my money is not safe.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
            </section>
         </article>
         <article class="chapter" id="R.1.4">
            <header class="chapter-titlepage">
               <h2>Chapter 2. ACT II</h2>
            </header>
            <div class="lists-of-titles">
               <div class="toc">
                  <p>
                     <b>Table of Contents</b>
                  </p>
                  <ul class="toc">
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.2">1. SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                     <li>
                        <span>
                           <a href="#R.1.4.3">2. SCENE II.  A public place.</a>
                        </span>
                     </li>
                  </ul>
               </div>
            </div>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.2">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>1. SCENE I.  The house of ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ADRIANA and LUCIANA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Neither my husband nor the slave return'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">That in such haste I sent to seek his master!</div>
                     <div class="line">Sure, Luciana, it is two o'clock.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Perhaps some merchant hath invited him,</div>
                     <div class="line">And from the mart he's somewhere gone to dinner.</div>
                     <div class="line">Good sister, let us dine and never fret:</div>
                     <div class="line">A man is master of his liberty:</div>
                     <div class="line">Time is their master, and, when they see time,</div>
                     <div class="line">They'll go or come: if so, be patient, sister.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why should their liberty than ours be more?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Because their business still lies out o' door.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Look, when I serve him so, he takes it ill.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">O, know he is the bridle of your will.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">There's none but asses will be bridled so.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, headstrong liberty is lash'd with woe.</div>
                     <div class="line">There's nothing situate under heaven's eye</div>
                     <div class="line">But hath his bound, in earth, in sea, in sky:</div>
                     <div class="line">The beasts, the fishes, and the winged fowls,</div>
                     <div class="line">Are their males' subjects and at their controls:</div>
                     <div class="line">Men, more divine, the masters of all these,</div>
                     <div class="line">Lords of the wide world and wild watery seas,</div>
                     <div class="line">Indued with intellectual sense and souls,</div>
                     <div class="line">Of more preeminence than fish and fowls,</div>
                     <div class="line">Are masters to their females, and their lords:</div>
                     <div class="line">Then let your will attend on their accords.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">This servitude makes you to keep unwed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Not this, but troubles of the marriage-bed.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">But, were you wedded, you would bear some sway.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ere I learn love, I'll practise to obey.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">How if your husband start some other where?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Till he come home again, I would forbear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Patience unmoved! no marvel though she pause;</div>
                     <div class="line">They can be meek that have no other cause.</div>
                     <div class="line">A wretched soul, bruised with adversity,</div>
                     <div class="line">We bid be quiet when we hear it cry;</div>
                     <div class="line">But were we burdened with like weight of pain,</div>
                     <div class="line">As much or more would we ourselves complain:</div>
                     <div class="line">So thou, that hast no unkind mate to grieve thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">With urging helpless patience wouldst relieve me,</div>
                     <div class="line">But, if thou live to see like right bereft,</div>
                     <div class="line">This fool-begg'd patience in thee will be left.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, I will marry one day, but to try.</div>
                     <div class="line">Here comes your man; now is your husband nigh.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter DROMIO of Ephesus</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Say, is your tardy master now at hand?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, he's at two hands with me, and that my two ears</div>
                     <div class="line">can witness.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Say, didst thou speak with him? know'st thou his mind?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, ay, he told his mind upon mine ear:</div>
                     <div class="line">Beshrew his hand, I scarce could understand it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Spake he so doubtfully, thou couldst not feel his meaning?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, he struck so plainly, I could too well feel his</div>
                     <div class="line">blows; and withal so doubtfully that I could scarce</div>
                     <div class="line">understand them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">But say, I prithee, is he coming home? It seems he</div>
                     <div class="line">hath great care to please his wife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, mistress, sure my master is horn-mad.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Horn-mad, thou villain!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I mean not cuckold-mad;</div>
                     <div class="line">But, sure, he is stark mad.</div>
                     <div class="line">When I desired him to come home to dinner,</div>
                     <div class="line">He ask'd me for a thousand marks in gold:</div>
                     <div class="line">''Tis dinner-time,' quoth I; 'My gold!' quoth he;</div>
                     <div class="line">'Your meat doth burn,' quoth I; 'My gold!' quoth he:</div>
                     <div class="line">'Will you come home?' quoth I; 'My gold!' quoth he.</div>
                     <div class="line">'Where is the thousand marks I gave thee, villain?'</div>
                     <div class="line">'The pig,' quoth I, 'is burn'd;' 'My gold!' quoth he:</div>
                     <div class="line">'My mistress, sir' quoth I; 'Hang up thy mistress!</div>
                     <div class="line">I know not thy mistress; out on thy mistress!'</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Quoth who?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Quoth my master:</div>
                     <div class="line">'I know,' quoth he, 'no house, no wife, no mistress.'</div>
                     <div class="line">So that my errand, due unto my tongue,</div>
                     <div class="line">I thank him, I bare home upon my shoulders;</div>
                     <div class="line">For, in conclusion, he did beat me there.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Go back again, thou slave, and fetch him home.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Go back again, and be new beaten home?</div>
                     <div class="line">For God's sake, send some other messenger.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Back, slave, or I will break thy pate across.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">And he will bless that cross with other beating:</div>
                     <div class="line">Between you I shall have a holy head.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Hence, prating peasant! fetch thy master home.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Am I so round with you as you with me,</div>
                     <div class="line">That like a football you do spurn me thus?</div>
                     <div class="line">You spurn me hence, and he will spurn me hither:</div>
                     <div class="line">If I last in this service, you must case me in leather.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie, how impatience loureth in your face!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">His company must do his minions grace,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whilst I at home starve for a merry look.</div>
                     <div class="line">Hath homely age the alluring beauty took</div>
                     <div class="line">From my poor cheek? then he hath wasted it:</div>
                     <div class="line">Are my discourses dull? barren my wit?</div>
                     <div class="line">If voluble and sharp discourse be marr'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unkindness blunts it more than marble hard:</div>
                     <div class="line">Do their gay vestments his affections bait?</div>
                     <div class="line">That's not my fault: he's master of my state:</div>
                     <div class="line">What ruins are in me that can be found,</div>
                     <div class="line">By him not ruin'd? then is he the ground</div>
                     <div class="line">Of my defeatures. My decayed fair</div>
                     <div class="line">A sunny look of his would soon repair</div>
                     <div class="line">But, too unruly deer, he breaks the pale</div>
                     <div class="line">And feeds from home; poor I am but his stale.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Self-harming jealousy! fie, beat it hence!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Unfeeling fools can with such wrongs dispense.</div>
                     <div class="line">I know his eye doth homage otherwhere,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or else what lets it but he would be here?</div>
                     <div class="line">Sister, you know he promised me a chain;</div>
                     <div class="line">Would that alone, alone he would detain,</div>
                     <div class="line">So he would keep fair quarter with his bed!</div>
                     <div class="line">I see the jewel best enamelled</div>
                     <div class="line">Will lose his beauty; yet the gold bides still,</div>
                     <div class="line">That others touch, and often touching will</div>
                     <div class="line">Wear gold: and no man that hath a name,</div>
                     <div class="line">By falsehood and corruption doth it shame.</div>
                     <div class="line">Since that my beauty cannot please his eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll weep what's left away, and weeping die.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">How many fond fools serve mad jealousy!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
            <section class="section" id="R.1.4.3">
               <div class="section-titlepage">
                  <h2>2. SCENE II.  A public place.</h2>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ANTIPHOLUS of Syracuse</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">The gold I gave to Dromio is laid up</div>
                     <div class="line">Safe at the Centaur; and the heedful slave</div>
                     <div class="line">Is wander'd forth, in care to seek me out</div>
                     <div class="line">By computation and mine host's report.</div>
                     <div class="line">I could not speak with Dromio since at first</div>
                     <div class="line">I sent him from the mart. See, here he comes.</div>
                     <p>Enter DROMIO of Syracuse</p>
                     <div class="line">How now sir! is your merry humour alter'd?</div>
                     <div class="line">As you love strokes, so jest with me again.</div>
                     <div class="line">You know no Centaur? you received no gold?</div>
                     <div class="line">Your mistress sent to have me home to dinner?</div>
                     <div class="line">My house was at the Phoenix? Wast thou mad,</div>
                     <div class="line">That thus so madly thou didst answer me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">What answer, sir? when spake I such a word?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Even now, even here, not half an hour since.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">I did not see you since you sent me hence,</div>
                     <div class="line">Home to the Centaur, with the gold you gave me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Villain, thou didst deny the gold's receipt,</div>
                     <div class="line">And told'st me of a mistress and a dinner;</div>
                     <div class="line">For which, I hope, thou felt'st I was displeased.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">I am glad to see you in this merry vein:</div>
                     <div class="line">What means this jest? I pray you, master, tell me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Yea, dost thou jeer and flout me in the teeth?</div>
                     <div class="line">Think'st thou I jest? Hold, take thou that, and that.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Beating him</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Hold, sir, for God's sake! now your jest is earnest:</div>
                     <div class="line">Upon what bargain do you give it me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Because that I familiarly sometimes</div>
                     <div class="line">Do use you for my fool and chat with you,</div>
                     <div class="line">Your sauciness will jest upon my love</div>
                     <div class="line">And make a common of my serious hours.</div>
                     <div class="line">When the sun shines let foolish gnats make sport,</div>
                     <div class="line">But creep in crannies when he hides his beams.</div>
                     <div class="line">If you will jest with me, know my aspect,</div>
                     <div class="line">And fashion your demeanor to my looks,</div>
                     <div class="line">Or I will beat this method in your sconce.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Sconce call you it? so you would leave battering, I</div>
                     <div class="line">had rather have it a head: an you use these blows</div>
                     <div class="line">long, I must get a sconce for my head and ensconce</div>
                     <div class="line">it too; or else I shall seek my wit in my shoulders.</div>
                     <div class="line">But, I pray, sir why am I beaten?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Dost thou not know?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Nothing, sir, but that I am beaten.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Shall I tell you why?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, sir, and wherefore; for they say every why hath</div>
                     <div class="line">a wherefore.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, first,--for flouting me; and then, wherefore--</div>
                     <div class="line">For urging it the second time to me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Was there ever any man thus beaten out of season,</div>
                     <div class="line">When in the why and the wherefore is neither rhyme</div>
                     <div class="line">nor reason?</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, sir, I thank you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Thank me, sir, for what?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, sir, for this something that you gave me for nothing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">I'll make you amends next, to give you nothing for</div>
                     <div class="line">something. But say, sir, is it dinner-time?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">No, sir; I think the meat wants that I have.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">In good time, sir; what's that?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Basting.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, sir, then 'twill be dry.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">If it be, sir, I pray you, eat none of it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Your reason?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Lest it make you choleric and purchase me another</div>
                     <div class="line">dry basting.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Well, sir, learn to jest in good time: there's a</div>
                     <div class="line">time for all things.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">I durst have denied that, before you were so choleric.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">By what rule, sir?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, sir, by a rule as plain as the plain bald</div>
                     <div class="line">pate of father Time himself.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Let's hear it.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">There's no time for a man to recover his hair that</div>
                     <div class="line">grows bald by nature.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">May he not do it by fine and recovery?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Yes, to pay a fine for a periwig and recover the</div>
                     <div class="line">lost hair of another man.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why is Time such a niggard of hair, being, as it is,</div>
                     <div class="line">so plentiful an excrement?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Because it is a blessing that he bestows on beasts;</div>
                     <div class="line">and what he hath scanted men in hair he hath given them in wit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, but there's many a man hath more hair than wit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Not a man of those but he hath the wit to lose his hair.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, thou didst conclude hairy men plain dealers without wit.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">The plainer dealer, the sooner lost: yet he loseth</div>
                     <div class="line">it in a kind of jollity.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">For what reason?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">For two; and sound ones too.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, not sound, I pray you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Sure ones, then.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, not sure, in a thing falsing.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Certain ones then.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Name them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">The one, to save the money that he spends in</div>
                     <div class="line">trimming; the other, that at dinner they should not</div>
                     <div class="line">drop in his porridge.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">You would all this time have proved there is no</div>
                     <div class="line">time for all things.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Marry, and did, sir; namely, no time to recover hair</div>
                     <div class="line">lost by nature.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">But your reason was not substantial, why there is no</div>
                     <div class="line">time to recover.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Thus I mend it: Time himself is bald and therefore</div>
                     <div class="line">to the world's end will have bald followers.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">I knew 'twould be a bald conclusion:</div>
                     <div class="line">But, soft! who wafts us yonder?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ADRIANA and LUCIANA</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, ay, Antipholus, look strange and frown:</div>
                     <div class="line">Some other mistress hath thy sweet aspects;</div>
                     <div class="line">I am not Adriana nor thy wife.</div>
                     <div class="line">The time was once when thou unurged wouldst vow</div>
                     <div class="line">That never words were music to thine ear,</div>
                     <div class="line">That never object pleasing in thine eye,</div>
                     <div class="line">That never touch well welcome to thy hand,</div>
                     <div class="line">That never meat sweet-savor'd in thy taste,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless I spake, or look'd, or touch'd, or carved to thee.</div>
                     <div class="line">How comes it now, my husband, O, how comes it,</div>
                     <div class="line">That thou art thus estranged from thyself?</div>
                     <div class="line">Thyself I call it, being strange to me,</div>
                     <div class="line">That, undividable, incorporate,</div>
                     <div class="line">Am better than thy dear self's better part.</div>
                     <div class="line">Ah, do not tear away thyself from me!</div>
                     <div class="line">For know, my love, as easy mayest thou fall</div>
                     <div class="line">A drop of water in the breaking gulf,</div>
                     <div class="line">And take unmingled that same drop again,</div>
                     <div class="line">Without addition or diminishing,</div>
                     <div class="line">As take from me thyself and not me too.</div>
                     <div class="line">How dearly would it touch me to the quick,</div>
                     <div class="line">Shouldst thou but hear I were licentious</div>
                     <div class="line">And that this body, consecrate to thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">By ruffian lust should be contaminate!</div>
                     <div class="line">Wouldst thou not spit at me and spurn at me</div>
                     <div class="line">And hurl the name of husband in my face</div>
                     <div class="line">And tear the stain'd skin off my harlot-brow</div>
                     <div class="line">And from my false hand cut the wedding-ring</div>
                     <div class="line">And break it with a deep-divorcing vow?</div>
                     <div class="line">I know thou canst; and therefore see thou do it.</div>
                     <div class="line">I am possess'd with an adulterate blot;</div>
                     <div class="line">My blood is mingled with the crime of lust:</div>
                     <div class="line">For if we too be one and thou play false,</div>
                     <div class="line">I do digest the poison of thy flesh,</div>
                     <div class="line">Being strumpeted by thy contagion.</div>
                     <div class="line">Keep then far league and truce with thy true bed;</div>
                     <div class="line">I live unstain'd, thou undishonoured.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Plead you to me, fair dame? I know you not:</div>
                     <div class="line">In Ephesus I am but two hours old,</div>
                     <div class="line">As strange unto your town as to your talk;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who, every word by all my wit being scann'd,</div>
                     <div class="line">Want wit in all one word to understand.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Fie, brother! how the world is changed with you!</div>
                     <div class="line">When were you wont to use my sister thus?</div>
                     <div class="line">She sent for you by Dromio home to dinner.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">By Dromio?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">By me?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">By thee; and this thou didst return from him,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he did buffet thee, and, in his blows,</div>
                     <div class="line">Denied my house for his, me for his wife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Did you converse, sir, with this gentlewoman?</div>
                     <div class="line">What is the course and drift of your compact?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">I, sir? I never saw her till this time.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Villain, thou liest; for even her very words</div>
                     <div class="line">Didst thou deliver to me on the mart.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">I never spake with her in all my life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">How can she thus then call us by our names,</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless it be by inspiration.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">How ill agrees it with your gravity</div>
                     <div class="line">To counterfeit thus grossly with your slave,</div>
                     <div class="line">Abetting him to thwart me in my mood!</div>
                     <div class="line">Be it my wrong you are from me exempt,</div>
                     <div class="line">But wrong not that wrong with a more contempt.</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, I will fasten on this sleeve of thine:</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou art an elm, my husband, I a vine,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose weakness, married to thy stronger state,</div>
