                     <div class="line">He shall not die; so much we tender him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Justice, most sacred duke, against the abbess!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                     <div class="line">She is a virtuous and a reverend lady:</div>
                     <div class="line">It cannot be that she hath done thee wrong.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">May it please your grace, Antipholus, my husband,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whom I made lord of me and all I had,</div>
                     <div class="line">At your important letters,--this ill day</div>
                     <div class="line">A most outrageous fit of madness took him;</div>
                     <div class="line">That desperately he hurried through the street,</div>
                     <div class="line">With him his bondman, all as mad as he--</div>
                     <div class="line">Doing displeasure to the citizens</div>
                     <div class="line">By rushing in their houses, bearing thence</div>
                     <div class="line">Rings, jewels, any thing his rage did like.</div>
                     <div class="line">Once did I get him bound and sent him home,</div>
                     <div class="line">Whilst to take order for the wrongs I went,</div>
                     <div class="line">That here and there his fury had committed.</div>
                     <div class="line">Anon, I wot not by what strong escape,</div>
                     <div class="line">He broke from those that had the guard of him;</div>
                     <div class="line">And with his mad attendant and himself,</div>
                     <div class="line">Each one with ireful passion, with drawn swords,</div>
                     <div class="line">Met us again and madly bent on us,</div>
                     <div class="line">Chased us away; till, raising of more aid,</div>
                     <div class="line">We came again to bind them. Then they fled</div>
                     <div class="line">Into this abbey, whither we pursued them:</div>
                     <div class="line">And here the abbess shuts the gates on us</div>
                     <div class="line">And will not suffer us to fetch him out,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor send him forth that we may bear him hence.</div>
                     <div class="line">Therefore, most gracious duke, with thy command</div>
                     <div class="line">Let him be brought forth and borne hence for help.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Long since thy husband served me in my wars,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I to thee engaged a prince's word,</div>
                     <div class="line">When thou didst make him master of thy bed,</div>
                     <div class="line">To do him all the grace and good I could.</div>
                     <div class="line">Go, some of you, knock at the abbey-gate</div>
                     <div class="line">And bid the lady abbess come to me.</div>
                     <div class="line">I will determine this before I stir.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter a Servant</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">O mistress, mistress, shift and save yourself!</div>
                     <div class="line">My master and his man are both broke loose,</div>
                     <div class="line">Beaten the maids a-row and bound the doctor</div>
                     <div class="line">Whose beard they have singed off with brands of fire;</div>
                     <div class="line">And ever, as it blazed, they threw on him</div>
                     <div class="line">Great pails of puddled mire to quench the hair:</div>
                     <div class="line">My master preaches patience to him and the while</div>
                     <div class="line">His man with scissors nicks him like a fool,</div>
                     <div class="line">And sure, unless you send some present help,</div>
                     <div class="line">Between them they will kill the conjurer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Peace, fool! thy master and his man are here,</div>
                     <div class="line">And that is false thou dost report to us.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Servant</div>
                     <div class="line">Mistress, upon my life, I tell you true;</div>
                     <div class="line">I have not breathed almost since I did see it.</div>
                     <div class="line">He cries for you, and vows, if he can take you,</div>
                     <div class="line">To scorch your face and to disfigure you.</div>
                     <p>Cry within</p>
                     <div class="line">Hark, hark! I hear him, mistress. fly, be gone!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, stand by me; fear nothing. Guard with halberds!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay me, it is my husband! Witness you,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he is borne about invisible:</div>
                     <div class="line">Even now we housed him in the abbey here;</div>
                     <div class="line">And now he's there, past thought of human reason.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Enter ANTIPHOLUS of Ephesus and DROMIO of Ephesus</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Justice, most gracious duke, O, grant me justice!</div>
                     <div class="line">Even for the service that long since I did thee,</div>
                     <div class="line">When I bestrid thee in the wars and took</div>
                     <div class="line">Deep scars to save thy life; even for the blood</div>
                     <div class="line">That then I lost for thee, now grant me justice.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AEGEON</div>
                     <div class="line">Unless the fear of death doth make me dote,</div>
                     <div class="line">I see my son Antipholus and Dromio.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Justice, sweet prince, against that woman there!</div>
                     <div class="line">She whom thou gavest to me to be my wife,</div>
                     <div class="line">That hath abused and dishonour'd me</div>
                     <div class="line">Even in the strength and height of injury!</div>
                     <div class="line">Beyond imagination is the wrong</div>
                     <div class="line">That she this day hath shameless thrown on me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Discover how, and thou shalt find me just.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">This day, great duke, she shut the doors upon me,</div>
                     <div class="line">While she with harlots feasted in my house.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                     <div class="line">A grievous fault! Say, woman, didst thou so?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">No, my good lord: myself, he and my sister</div>
                     <div class="line">To-day did dine together. So befall my soul</div>
                     <div class="line">As this is false he burdens me withal!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">LUCIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Ne'er may I look on day, nor sleep on night,</div>
                     <div class="line">But she tells to your highness simple truth!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANGELO</div>
                     <div class="line">O perjured woman! They are both forsworn:</div>
                     <div class="line">In this the madman justly chargeth them.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">My liege, I am advised what I say,</div>
                     <div class="line">Neither disturbed with the effect of wine,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor heady-rash, provoked with raging ire,</div>
                     <div class="line">Albeit my wrongs might make one wiser mad.</div>
                     <div class="line">This woman lock'd me out this day from dinner:</div>
                     <div class="line">That goldsmith there, were he not pack'd with her,</div>
                     <div class="line">Could witness it, for he was with me then;</div>
                     <div class="line">Who parted with me to go fetch a chain,</div>
                     <div class="line">Promising to bring it to the Porpentine,</div>
                     <div class="line">Where Balthazar and I did dine together.</div>
                     <div class="line">Our dinner done, and he not coming thither,</div>
                     <div class="line">I went to seek him: in the street I met him</div>
                     <div class="line">And in his company that gentleman.</div>
                     <div class="line">There did this perjured goldsmith swear me down</div>
                     <div class="line">That I this day of him received the chain,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which, God he knows, I saw not: for the which</div>
                     <div class="line">He did arrest me with an officer.</div>
                     <div class="line">I did obey, and sent my peasant home</div>
                     <div class="line">For certain ducats: he with none return'd</div>
                     <div class="line">Then fairly I bespoke the officer</div>
                     <div class="line">To go in person with me to my house.</div>
                     <div class="line">By the way we met</div>
                     <div class="line">My wife, her sister, and a rabble more</div>
                     <div class="line">Of vile confederates. Along with them</div>
                     <div class="line">They brought one Pinch, a hungry lean-faced villain,</div>
                     <div class="line">A mere anatomy, a mountebank,</div>
                     <div class="line">A threadbare juggler and a fortune-teller,</div>
                     <div class="line">A needy, hollow-eyed, sharp-looking wretch,</div>
                     <div class="line">A dead-looking man: this pernicious slave,</div>
                     <div class="line">Forsooth, took on him as a conjurer,</div>
                     <div class="line">And, gazing in mine eyes, feeling my pulse,</div>
                     <div class="line">And with no face, as 'twere, outfacing me,</div>
                     <div class="line">Cries out, I was possess'd. Then all together</div>
                     <div class="line">They fell upon me, bound me, bore me thence</div>
                     <div class="line">And in a dark and dankish vault at home</div>
                     <div class="line">There left me and my man, both bound together;</div>
                     <div class="line">Till, gnawing with my teeth my bonds in sunder,</div>
                     <div class="line">I gain'd my freedom, and immediately</div>
                     <div class="line">Ran hither to your grace; whom I beseech</div>
                     <div class="line">To give me ample satisfaction</div>
                     <div class="line">For these deep shames and great indignities.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANGELO</div>
                     <div class="line">My lord, in truth, thus far I witness with him,</div>
                     <div class="line">That he dined not at home, but was lock'd out.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                     <div class="line">But had he such a chain of thee or no?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANGELO</div>
                     <div class="line">He had, my lord: and when he ran in here,</div>
                     <div class="line">These people saw the chain about his neck.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Second Merchant</div>
                     <div class="line">Besides, I will be sworn these ears of mine</div>
                     <div class="line">Heard you confess you had the chain of him</div>
                     <div class="line">After you first forswore it on the mart:</div>
                     <div class="line">And thereupon I drew my sword on you;</div>
                     <div class="line">And then you fled into this abbey here,</div>
                     <div class="line">From whence, I think, you are come by miracle.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I never came within these abbey-walls,</div>
                     <div class="line">Nor ever didst thou draw thy sword on me:</div>
                     <div class="line">I never saw the chain, so help me Heaven!</div>
                     <div class="line">And this is false you burden me withal.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, what an intricate impeach is this!</div>
                     <div class="line">I think you all have drunk of Circe's cup.</div>
                     <div class="line">If here you housed him, here he would have been;</div>
                     <div class="line">If he were mad, he would not plead so coldly:</div>
                     <div class="line">You say he dined at home; the goldsmith here</div>
                     <div class="line">Denies that saying. Sirrah, what say you?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, he dined with her there, at the Porpentine.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Courtezan</div>
                     <div class="line">He did, and from my finger snatch'd that ring.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">'Tis true, my liege; this ring I had of her.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Saw'st thou him enter at the abbey here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Courtezan</div>
                     <div class="line">As sure, my liege, as I do see your grace.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, this is strange. Go call the abbess hither.</div>
                     <div class="line">I think you are all mated or stark mad.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exit one to Abbess</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AEGEON</div>
                     <div class="line">Most mighty duke, vouchsafe me speak a word:</div>
                     <div class="line">Haply I see a friend will save my life</div>
                     <div class="line">And pay the sum that may deliver me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak freely, Syracusian, what thou wilt.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AEGEON</div>
                     <div class="line">Is not your name, sir, call'd Antipholus?</div>
                     <div class="line">And is not that your bondman, Dromio?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Within this hour I was his bondman sir,</div>
                     <div class="line">But he, I thank him, gnaw'd in two my cords:</div>
                     <div class="line">Now am I Dromio and his man unbound.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AEGEON</div>
                     <div class="line">I am sure you both of you remember me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ourselves we do remember, sir, by you;</div>
                     <div class="line">For lately we were bound, as you are now</div>
                     <div class="line">You are not Pinch's patient, are you, sir?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AEGEON</div>
                     <div class="line">Why look you strange on me? you know me well.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AEGEON</div>
                     <div class="line">O, grief hath changed me since you saw me last,</div>
                     <div class="line">And careful hours with time's deformed hand</div>
                     <div class="line">Have written strange defeatures in my face:</div>
                     <div class="line">But tell me yet, dost thou not know my voice?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Neither.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AEGEON</div>
                     <div class="line">Dromio, nor thou?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">No, trust me, sir, nor I.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AEGEON</div>
                     <div class="line">I am sure thou dost.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Ay, sir, but I am sure I do not; and whatsoever a</div>
                     <div class="line">man denies, you are now bound to believe him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AEGEON</div>
                     <div class="line">Not know my voice! O time's extremity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Hast thou so crack'd and splitted my poor tongue</div>
                     <div class="line">In seven short years, that here my only son</div>
                     <div class="line">Knows not my feeble key of untuned cares?</div>
                     <div class="line">Though now this grained face of mine be hid</div>
                     <div class="line">In sap-consuming winter's drizzled snow,</div>
                     <div class="line">And all the conduits of my blood froze up,</div>
                     <div class="line">Yet hath my night of life some memory,</div>
                     <div class="line">My wasting lamps some fading glimmer left,</div>
                     <div class="line">My dull deaf ears a little use to hear:</div>
                     <div class="line">All these old witnesses--I cannot err--</div>
                     <div class="line">Tell me thou art my son Antipholus.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I never saw my father in my life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AEGEON</div>
                     <div class="line">But seven years since, in Syracusa, boy,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou know'st we parted: but perhaps, my son,</div>
                     <div class="line">Thou shamest to acknowledge me in misery.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">The duke and all that know me in the city</div>
                     <div class="line">Can witness with me that it is not so</div>
                     <div class="line">I ne'er saw Syracusa in my life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I tell thee, Syracusian, twenty years</div>
                     <div class="line">Have I been patron to Antipholus,</div>
                     <div class="line">During which time he ne'er saw Syracusa:</div>
                     <div class="line">I see thy age and dangers make thee dote.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Re-enter AEMILIA, with ANTIPHOLUS of Syracuse and
DROMIO of Syracuse</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AEMELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Most mighty duke, behold a man much wrong'd.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>All gather to see them</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">I see two husbands, or mine eyes deceive me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                     <div class="line">One of these men is Genius to the other;</div>
                     <div class="line">And so of these. Which is the natural man,</div>
                     <div class="line">And which the spirit? who deciphers them?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">I, sir, am Dromio; command him away.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I, sir, am Dromio; pray, let me stay.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">AEgeon art thou not? or else his ghost?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">O, my old master! who hath bound him here?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AEMELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Whoever bound him, I will loose his bonds</div>
                     <div class="line">And gain a husband by his liberty.</div>
                     <div class="line">Speak, old AEgeon, if thou be'st the man</div>
                     <div class="line">That hadst a wife once call'd AEmilia</div>
                     <div class="line">That bore thee at a burden two fair sons:</div>
                     <div class="line">O, if thou be'st the same AEgeon, speak,</div>
                     <div class="line">And speak unto the same AEmilia!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AEGEON</div>
                     <div class="line">If I dream not, thou art AEmilia:</div>
                     <div class="line">If thou art she, tell me where is that son</div>
                     <div class="line">That floated with thee on the fatal raft?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AEMELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">By men of Epidamnum he and I</div>
                     <div class="line">And the twin Dromio all were taken up;</div>
                     <div class="line">But by and by rude fishermen of Corinth</div>
                     <div class="line">By force took Dromio and my son from them</div>
                     <div class="line">And me they left with those of Epidamnum.</div>
                     <div class="line">What then became of them I cannot tell</div>
                     <div class="line">I to this fortune that you see me in.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Why, here begins his morning story right;</div>
                     <div class="line">These two Antipholuses, these two so like,</div>
                     <div class="line">And these two Dromios, one in semblance,--</div>
                     <div class="line">Besides her urging of her wreck at sea,--</div>
                     <div class="line">These are the parents to these children,</div>
                     <div class="line">Which accidentally are met together.</div>
                     <div class="line">Antipholus, thou camest from Corinth first?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">No, sir, not I; I came from Syracuse.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Stay, stand apart; I know not which is which.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">I came from Corinth, my most gracious lord,--</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">And I with him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Brought to this town by that most famous warrior,</div>
                     <div class="line">Duke Menaphon, your most renowned uncle.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">Which of you two did dine with me to-day?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">I, gentle mistress.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">And are not you my husband?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">No; I say nay to that.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">And so do I; yet did she call me so:</div>
                     <div class="line">And this fair gentlewoman, her sister here,</div>
                     <div class="line">Did call me brother.</div>
                     <p>To Luciana</p>
                     <div class="line">What I told you then,</div>
                     <div class="line">I hope I shall have leisure to make good;</div>
                     <div class="line">If this be not a dream I see and hear.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANGELO</div>
                     <div class="line">That is the chain, sir, which you had of me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">I think it be, sir; I deny it not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">And you, sir, for this chain arrested me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANGELO</div>
                     <div class="line">I think I did, sir; I deny it not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ADRIANA</div>
                     <div class="line">I sent you money, sir, to be your bail,</div>
                     <div class="line">By Dromio; but I think he brought it not.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">No, none by me.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">This purse of ducats I received from you,</div>
                     <div class="line">And Dromio, my man, did bring them me.</div>
                     <div class="line">I see we still did meet each other's man,</div>
                     <div class="line">And I was ta'en for him, and he for me,</div>
                     <div class="line">And thereupon these errors are arose.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">These ducats pawn I for my father here.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                     <div class="line">It shall not need; thy father hath his life.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">Courtezan</div>
                     <div class="line">Sir, I must have that diamond from you.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">There, take it; and much thanks for my good cheer.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">AEMELIA</div>
                     <div class="line">Renowned duke, vouchsafe to take the pains</div>
                     <div class="line">To go with us into the abbey here</div>
                     <div class="line">And hear at large discoursed all our fortunes:</div>
                     <div class="line">And all that are assembled in this place,</div>
                     <div class="line">That by this sympathized one day's error</div>
                     <div class="line">Have suffer'd wrong, go keep us company,</div>
                     <div class="line">And we shall make full satisfaction.</div>
                     <div class="line">Thirty-three years have I but gone in travail</div>
                     <div class="line">Of you, my sons; and till this present hour</div>
                     <div class="line">My heavy burden ne'er delivered.</div>
                     <div class="line">The duke, my husband and my children both,</div>
                     <div class="line">And you the calendars of their nativity,</div>
                     <div class="line">Go to a gossips' feast and go with me;</div>
                     <div class="line">After so long grief, such festivity!</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                     <div class="line">With all my heart, I'll gossip at this feast.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt all but Antipholus of Syracuse, Antipholus
of Ephesus, Dromio of Syracuse and Dromio of Ephesus</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Master, shall I fetch your stuff from shipboard?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Dromio, what stuff of mine hast thou embark'd?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Your goods that lay at host, sir, in the Centaur.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">He speaks to me. I am your master, Dromio:</div>
                     <div class="line">Come, go with us; we'll look to that anon:</div>
                     <div class="line">Embrace thy brother there; rejoice with him.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt Antipholus of Syracuse and Antipholus of Ephesus</p>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">There is a fat friend at your master's house,</div>
                     <div class="line">That kitchen'd me for you to-day at dinner:</div>
                     <div class="line">She now shall be my sister, not my wife.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Methinks you are my glass, and not my brother:</div>
                     <div class="line">I see by you I am a sweet-faced youth.</div>
                     <div class="line">Will you walk in to see their gossiping?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">Not I, sir; you are my elder.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">That's a question: how shall we try it?</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                     <div class="line">We'll draw cuts for the senior: till then lead thou first.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="dialogue">
                  <div class="linegroup">
                     <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                     <div class="line">Nay, then, thus:</div>
                     <div class="line">We came into the world like brother and brother;</div>
                     <div class="line">And now let's go hand in hand, not one before another.</div>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <p>Exeunt</p>
            </section>
         </article>
      </article>
      <script src="../../resources/js/prism.js"/>
   </body>
</html>

      <link href="../../resources/css/publishers.css" rel="stylesheet" type="text/css"/>

      <meta content="DocBook XSL 2.0 Stylesheets Vxxx" name="generator"/>
      <script src="../../resources/js/dbmodnizr.js" type="text/javascript"/>
      <title>The Comedy of Errors</title>
   </head>
   <body>

            <h1>The Comedy of Errors</h1>
         </header>

                           </span>
                        </li>

                           </span>

                     </ul>

                           </span>

                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>

                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>

                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
                  <li>
                     <span>
                        <a href="#R.1.7">5. ACT V</a>
                     </span>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.7.2">1. SCENE I.  A street before a Priory.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </li>
               </ul>
            </div>
         </div>
         <div class="content">
            <article class="preface" id="R.1.2">
               <header class="preface-titlepage">
                  <h2>Dramatis Personae</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="content">
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">SOLINUS, Duke of Ephesus. </span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">AEGEON, a merchant of Syracuse.</span>
                  </p>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">ANTIPHOLUS OF EPHESUS</span>
                              <span class="personname">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">twin brothers, and sons to Aegeon and Aemilia.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <table border="0" class="simplelist" summary="Simple list">
                     <tr>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">
                              <span class="personname">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</span>
                              <span class="personname">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</span>
                           </span>
                        </td>
                        <td>
                           <span class="member">twin brothers, and attendants on the two Antipholuses.</span>
                        </td>
                     </tr>
                  </table>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">BALTHAZAR, a merchant</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">ANGELO, a goldsmith.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">First Merchant, friend to Antipholus of Syracuse.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Second Merchant, to whom Angelo is a debtor.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">PINCH, a schoolmaster.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">AEMILIA, wife to Aegeon, an abbess at Ephesus.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">ADRIANA, wife to Antipholus of Ephesus.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">LUCIANA, her sister.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">LUCE, servant to Adriana.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">A Courtezan.</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>
                     <span class="personname">Gaoler, Officers, and other Attendants</span>
                  </p>
                  <p>SCENE  Ephesus.</p>
               </div>
            </article>
            <article class="chapter" id="R.1.3">
               <header class="chapter-titlepage">
                  <h2>Chapter 1. ACT I</h2>
               </header>
               <div class="lists-of-titles">
                  <div class="toc">
                     <p>
                        <b>Table of Contents</b>
                     </p>
                     <ul class="toc">
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.2">1. SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                        <li>
                           <span>
                              <a href="#R.1.3.3">2. SCENE II.  The Mart.</a>
                           </span>
                        </li>
                     </ul>
                  </div>
               </div>
               <div class="content">
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.2">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>1. SCENE I.  A hall in DUKE SOLINUS'S palace.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter DUKE SOLINUS, AEGEON, Gaoler, Officers, and other
Attendants</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AEGEON</div>
                              <div class="line">Proceed, Solinus, to procure my fall</div>
                              <div class="line">And by the doom of death end woes and all.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Merchant of Syracuse, plead no more;</div>
                              <div class="line">I am not partial to infringe our laws:</div>
                              <div class="line">The enmity and discord which of late</div>
                              <div class="line">Sprung from the rancorous outrage of your duke</div>
                              <div class="line">To merchants, our well-dealing countrymen,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who wanting guilders to redeem their lives</div>
                              <div class="line">Have seal'd his rigorous statutes with their bloods,</div>
                              <div class="line">Excludes all pity from our threatening looks.</div>
                              <div class="line">For, since the mortal and intestine jars</div>
                              <div class="line">'Twixt thy seditious countrymen and us,</div>
                              <div class="line">It hath in solemn synods been decreed</div>
                              <div class="line">Both by the Syracusians and ourselves,</div>
                              <div class="line">To admit no traffic to our adverse towns Nay, more,</div>
                              <div class="line">If any born at Ephesus be seen</div>
                              <div class="line">At any Syracusian marts and fairs;</div>
                              <div class="line">Again: if any Syracusian born</div>
                              <div class="line">Come to the bay of Ephesus, he dies,</div>
                              <div class="line">His goods confiscate to the duke's dispose,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unless a thousand marks be levied,</div>
                              <div class="line">To quit the penalty and to ransom him.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thy substance, valued at the highest rate,</div>
                              <div class="line">Cannot amount unto a hundred marks;</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore by law thou art condemned to die.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AEGEON</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet this my comfort: when your words are done,</div>
                              <div class="line">My woes end likewise with the evening sun.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Well, Syracusian, say in brief the cause</div>
                              <div class="line">Why thou departed'st from thy native home</div>
                              <div class="line">And for what cause thou camest to Ephesus.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AEGEON</div>
                              <div class="line">A heavier task could not have been imposed</div>
                              <div class="line">Than I to speak my griefs unspeakable:</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet, that the world may witness that my end</div>
                              <div class="line">Was wrought by nature, not by vile offence,</div>
                              <div class="line">I'll utter what my sorrows give me leave.</div>
                              <div class="line">In Syracusa was I born, and wed</div>
                              <div class="line">Unto a woman, happy but for me,</div>
                              <div class="line">And by me, had not our hap been bad.</div>
                              <div class="line">With her I lived in joy; our wealth increased</div>
                              <div class="line">By prosperous voyages I often made</div>
                              <div class="line">To Epidamnum; till my factor's death</div>
                              <div class="line">And the great care of goods at random left</div>
                              <div class="line">Drew me from kind embracements of my spouse:</div>
                              <div class="line">From whom my absence was not six months old</div>
                              <div class="line">Before herself, almost at fainting under</div>
                              <div class="line">The pleasing punishment that women bear,</div>
                              <div class="line">Had made provision for her following me</div>
                              <div class="line">And soon and safe arrived where I was.</div>
                              <div class="line">There had she not been long, but she became</div>
                              <div class="line">A joyful mother of two goodly sons;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, which was strange, the one so like the other,</div>
                              <div class="line">As could not be distinguish'd but by names.</div>
                              <div class="line">That very hour, and in the self-same inn,</div>
                              <div class="line">A meaner woman was delivered</div>
                              <div class="line">Of such a burden, male twins, both alike:</div>
                              <div class="line">Those,--for their parents were exceeding poor,--</div>
                              <div class="line">I bought and brought up to attend my sons.</div>
                              <div class="line">My wife, not meanly proud of two such boys,</div>
                              <div class="line">Made daily motions for our home return:</div>
                              <div class="line">Unwilling I agreed. Alas! too soon,</div>
                              <div class="line">We came aboard.</div>
                              <div class="line">A league from Epidamnum had we sail'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">Before the always wind-obeying deep</div>
                              <div class="line">Gave any tragic instance of our harm:</div>
                              <div class="line">But longer did we not retain much hope;</div>
                              <div class="line">For what obscured light the heavens did grant</div>
                              <div class="line">Did but convey unto our fearful minds</div>
                              <div class="line">A doubtful warrant of immediate death;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which though myself would gladly have embraced,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet the incessant weepings of my wife,</div>
                              <div class="line">Weeping before for what she saw must come,</div>
                              <div class="line">And piteous plainings of the pretty babes,</div>
                              <div class="line">That mourn'd for fashion, ignorant what to fear,</div>
                              <div class="line">Forced me to seek delays for them and me.</div>
                              <div class="line">And this it was, for other means was none:</div>
                              <div class="line">The sailors sought for safety by our boat,</div>
                              <div class="line">And left the ship, then sinking-ripe, to us:</div>
                              <div class="line">My wife, more careful for the latter-born,</div>
                              <div class="line">Had fasten'd him unto a small spare mast,</div>
                              <div class="line">Such as seafaring men provide for storms;</div>
                              <div class="line">To him one of the other twins was bound,</div>
                              <div class="line">Whilst I had been like heedful of the other:</div>
                              <div class="line">The children thus disposed, my wife and I,</div>
                              <div class="line">Fixing our eyes on whom our care was fix'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">Fasten'd ourselves at either end the mast;</div>
                              <div class="line">And floating straight, obedient to the stream,</div>
                              <div class="line">Was carried towards Corinth, as we thought.</div>
                              <div class="line">At length the sun, gazing upon the earth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Dispersed those vapours that offended us;</div>
                              <div class="line">And by the benefit of his wished light,</div>
                              <div class="line">The seas wax'd calm, and we discovered</div>
                              <div class="line">Two ships from far making amain to us,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of Corinth that, of Epidaurus this:</div>
                              <div class="line">But ere they came,--O, let me say no more!</div>
                              <div class="line">Gather the sequel by that went before.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Nay, forward, old man; do not break off so;</div>
                              <div class="line">For we may pity, though not pardon thee.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AEGEON</div>
                              <div class="line">O, had the gods done so, I had not now</div>
                              <div class="line">Worthily term'd them merciless to us!</div>
                              <div class="line">For, ere the ships could meet by twice five leagues,</div>
                              <div class="line">We were encounterd by a mighty rock;</div>
                              <div class="line">Which being violently borne upon,</div>
                              <div class="line">Our helpful ship was splitted in the midst;</div>
                              <div class="line">So that, in this unjust divorce of us,</div>
                              <div class="line">Fortune had left to both of us alike</div>
                              <div class="line">What to delight in, what to sorrow for.</div>
                              <div class="line">Her part, poor soul! seeming as burdened</div>
                              <div class="line">With lesser weight but not with lesser woe,</div>
                              <div class="line">Was carried with more speed before the wind;</div>
                              <div class="line">And in our sight they three were taken up</div>
                              <div class="line">By fishermen of Corinth, as we thought.</div>
                              <div class="line">At length, another ship had seized on us;</div>
                              <div class="line">And, knowing whom it was their hap to save,</div>
                              <div class="line">Gave healthful welcome to their shipwreck'd guests;</div>
                              <div class="line">And would have reft the fishers of their prey,</div>
                              <div class="line">Had not their bark been very slow of sail;</div>
                              <div class="line">And therefore homeward did they bend their course.</div>
                              <div class="line">Thus have you heard me sever'd from my bliss;</div>
                              <div class="line">That by misfortunes was my life prolong'd,</div>
                              <div class="line">To tell sad stories of my own mishaps.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                              <div class="line">And for the sake of them thou sorrowest for,</div>
                              <div class="line">Do me the favour to dilate at full</div>
                              <div class="line">What hath befall'n of them and thee till now.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AEGEON</div>
                              <div class="line">My youngest boy, and yet my eldest care,</div>
                              <div class="line">At eighteen years became inquisitive</div>
                              <div class="line">After his brother: and importuned me</div>
                              <div class="line">That his attendant--so his case was like,</div>
                              <div class="line">Reft of his brother, but retain'd his name--</div>
                              <div class="line">Might bear him company in the quest of him:</div>
                              <div class="line">Whom whilst I labour'd of a love to see,</div>
                              <div class="line">I hazarded the loss of whom I loved.</div>
                              <div class="line">Five summers have I spent in furthest Greece,</div>
                              <div class="line">Roaming clean through the bounds of Asia,</div>
                              <div class="line">And, coasting homeward, came to Ephesus;</div>
                              <div class="line">Hopeless to find, yet loath to leave unsought</div>
                              <div class="line">Or that or any place that harbours men.</div>
                              <div class="line">But here must end the story of my life;</div>
                              <div class="line">And happy were I in my timely death,</div>
                              <div class="line">Could all my travels warrant me they live.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DUKE SOLINUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Hapless AEgeon, whom the fates have mark'd</div>
                              <div class="line">To bear the extremity of dire mishap!</div>
                              <div class="line">Now, trust me, were it not against our laws,</div>
                              <div class="line">Against my crown, my oath, my dignity,</div>
                              <div class="line">Which princes, would they, may not disannul,</div>
                              <div class="line">My soul would sue as advocate for thee.</div>
                              <div class="line">But, though thou art adjudged to the death</div>
                              <div class="line">And passed sentence may not be recall'd</div>
                              <div class="line">But to our honour's great disparagement,</div>
                              <div class="line">Yet I will favour thee in what I can.</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore, merchant, I'll limit thee this day</div>
                              <div class="line">To seek thy life by beneficial help:</div>
                              <div class="line">Try all the friends thou hast in Ephesus;</div>
                              <div class="line">Beg thou, or borrow, to make up the sum,</div>
                              <div class="line">And live; if no, then thou art doom'd to die.</div>
                              <div class="line">Gaoler, take him to thy custody.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">Gaoler</div>
                              <div class="line">I will, my lord.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">AEGEON</div>
                              <div class="line">Hopeless and helpless doth AEgeon wend,</div>
                              <div class="line">But to procrastinate his lifeless end.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exeunt</p>
                     </div>
                  </section>
                  <section class="section" id="R.1.3.3">
                     <div class="section-titlepage">
                        <h2>2. SCENE II.  The Mart.</h2>
                     </div>
                     <div class="content">
                        <p>Enter ANTIPHOLUS of Syracuse, DROMIO of Syracuse,
and First Merchant</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Merchant</div>
                              <div class="line">Therefore give out you are of Epidamnum,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lest that your goods too soon be confiscate.</div>
                              <div class="line">This very day a Syracusian merchant</div>
                              <div class="line">Is apprehended for arrival here;</div>
                              <div class="line">And not being able to buy out his life</div>
                              <div class="line">According to the statute of the town,</div>
                              <div class="line">Dies ere the weary sun set in the west.</div>
                              <div class="line">There is your money that I had to keep.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                              <div class="line">Go bear it to the Centaur, where we host,</div>
                              <div class="line">And stay there, Dromio, till I come to thee.</div>
                              <div class="line">Within this hour it will be dinner-time:</div>
                              <div class="line">Till that, I'll view the manners of the town,</div>
                              <div class="line">Peruse the traders, gaze upon the buildings,</div>
                              <div class="line">And then return and sleep within mine inn,</div>
                              <div class="line">For with long travel I am stiff and weary.</div>
                              <div class="line">Get thee away.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF SYRACUSE</div>
                              <div class="line">Many a man would take you at your word,</div>
                              <div class="line">And go indeed, having so good a mean.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                              <div class="line">A trusty villain, sir, that very oft,</div>
                              <div class="line">When I am dull with care and melancholy,</div>
                              <div class="line">Lightens my humour with his merry jests.</div>
                              <div class="line">What, will you walk with me about the town,</div>
                              <div class="line">And then go to my inn and dine with me?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Merchant</div>
                              <div class="line">I am invited, sir, to certain merchants,</div>
                              <div class="line">Of whom I hope to make much benefit;</div>
                              <div class="line">I crave your pardon. Soon at five o'clock,</div>
                              <div class="line">Please you, I'll meet with you upon the mart</div>
                              <div class="line">And afterward consort you till bed-time:</div>
                              <div class="line">My present business calls me from you now.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                              <div class="line">Farewell till then: I will go lose myself</div>
                              <div class="line">And wander up and down to view the city.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">First Merchant</div>
                              <div class="line">Sir, I commend you to your own content.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <p>Exit</p>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                              <div class="line">He that commends me to mine own content</div>
                              <div class="line">Commends me to the thing I cannot get.</div>
                              <div class="line">I to the world am like a drop of water</div>
                              <div class="line">That in the ocean seeks another drop,</div>
                              <div class="line">Who, falling there to find his fellow forth,</div>
                              <div class="line">Unseen, inquisitive, confounds himself:</div>
                              <div class="line">So I, to find a mother and a brother,</div>
                              <div class="line">In quest of them, unhappy, lose myself.</div>
                              <p>Enter DROMIO of Ephesus</p>
                              <div class="line">Here comes the almanac of my true date.</div>
                              <div class="line">What now? how chance thou art return'd so soon?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                              <div class="line">Return'd so soon! rather approach'd too late:</div>
                              <div class="line">The capon burns, the pig falls from the spit,</div>
                              <div class="line">The clock hath strucken twelve upon the bell;</div>
                              <div class="line">My mistress made it one upon my cheek:</div>
                              <div class="line">She is so hot because the meat is cold;</div>
                              <div class="line">The meat is cold because you come not home;</div>
                              <div class="line">You come not home because you have no stomach;</div>
                              <div class="line">You have no stomach having broke your fast;</div>
                              <div class="line">But we that know what 'tis to fast and pray</div>
                              <div class="line">Are penitent for your default to-day.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                              <div class="line">Stop in your wind, sir: tell me this, I pray:</div>
                              <div class="line">Where have you left the money that I gave you?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                              <div class="line">O,--sixpence, that I had o' Wednesday last</div>
                              <div class="line">To pay the saddler for my mistress' crupper?</div>
                              <div class="line">The saddler had it, sir; I kept it not.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                              <div class="line">I am not in a sportive humour now:</div>
                              <div class="line">Tell me, and dally not, where is the money?</div>
                              <div class="line">We being strangers here, how darest thou trust</div>
                              <div class="line">So great a charge from thine own custody?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                              <div class="line">I pray you, air, as you sit at dinner:</div>
                              <div class="line">I from my mistress come to you in post;</div>
                              <div class="line">If I return, I shall be post indeed,</div>
                              <div class="line">For she will score your fault upon my pate.</div>
                              <div class="line">Methinks your maw, like mine, should be your clock,</div>
                              <div class="line">And strike you home without a messenger.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                              <div class="line">Come, Dromio, come, these jests are out of season;</div>
                              <div class="line">Reserve them till a merrier hour than this.</div>
                              <div class="line">Where is the gold I gave in charge to thee?</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                              <div class="line">To me, sir? why, you gave no gold to me.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                              <div class="line">Come on, sir knave, have done your foolishness,</div>
                              <div class="line">And tell me how thou hast disposed thy charge.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">DROMIO OF EPHESUS</div>
                              <div class="line">My charge was but to fetch you from the mart</div>
                              <div class="line">Home to your house, the Phoenix, sir, to dinner:</div>
                              <div class="line">My mistress and her sister stays for you.</div>
                           </div>
                        </div>
                        <div class="dialogue">
                           <div class="linegroup">
                              <div class="speaker">ANTIPHOLUS OF SYRACUSE</div>
                              <div class="line">In what safe place you have bestow'd my money,</div>
                              <div class="line">Or I shall break that merry sconce of yours</div>
